cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi NNE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to track northwest across the northwest Caribbean, cross the Yucatán Peninsula Saturday night, enter the south-central Gulf of Mexico Sunday, then continue north toward the north-central Gulf Coast with a likely landfall along the Louisiana coast late Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana Gulf Coast (near or just west of the Mississippi River delta)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancún, Mexico; no U.S. coastal watch at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning along portions of the Nicaragua, Honduras, and eastern Yucatán coasts; none along the U.S. coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama lies inside the 4- to 5-day cone, with greatest focus on Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible (up to 39–45 mph) late Monday into early Tuesday, though current probability is low (12%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: A storm surge of 3 feet or more is possible along the lower Mississippi River and adjacent Louisiana coast if the system makes landfall near the forecast track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands could produce totals of 4–6 inches with locally higher amounts across southeast and south-central Louisiana, including the Baton Rouge area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Freshwater river flooding and brief tornadoes in squalls could disrupt port operations and landside transportation links.
